titleStmt.title: To the right honourable Sir Christopher Hatton, Lord high Chauncelor of England &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: To the right honourable Sir Christopher Hatton, Lord high Chauncelor of England &c.

monogr.title: The faerie queene : Disposed into twelue books, fashioning XII. morall vertues
monogr.author: Spenser, Edmund

div.head: To the right honourable Sir Christopher Hatton, Lord high Chauncelor of England &c.
div.l: THose prudent heads, that with theire counsels wise
Whylom the Pillours of th' earth did sustaine,
And in the neck of all the world to rayne,
Oft from those graue affaires were wont abstaine,
With the sweet Lady Muses for to play:
So Maro oft did Caesars cares allay.
So you great Lord, that with your counsell sway
The burdeine of this kingdom mightily,
With like delightes sometimes may eke delay,
The rugged brow of carefull Policy:
And to these ydle rymes lend litle space,
Which for their titles sake may find more grace.
